intro: Friesodielsia velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It features lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense, velvety pubescence, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish-yellow flowers during the summer months. Its roots are fibrous and can form dense colonies, making it a persistent weed in agricultural fields. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus.
